entries.definition: Prioritized list of features, enhancements, and fixes awaiting implementation.
A requirement expressed from the end-user perspective, typically following the format 'As a [user], I want [goal], so that [benefit]'.
Time-boxed iteration (typically 1-4 weeks) for completing a set of user stories or tasks.
Large body of work that can be broken down into multiple user stories, typically spanning multiple sprints.
Minimum Viable Product - the smallest version of a product that delivers value and can be released to gather feedback.
Strategic plan showing the vision, direction, and progress of a product over time.
Toggle mechanism allowing features to be enabled or disabled without deploying new code.
Conditions that must be met for a user story to be considered complete and accepted.
Degree to which a product satisfies strong market demand.
Implied cost of additional rework caused by choosing quick solutions instead of better approaches that take longer.
